Edit 0 adds the `no_input=True` parameter to the `main.cookiecutter()` call, which changes the behavior of the cookiecutter template generation to use default values instead of prompting for input. Edit 1 updates the test assertions to expect 'python_boilerplate' instead of 'boilerplate' as the generated directory name. These edits are causally related because adding `no_input=True` causes cookiecutter to use the default project name ('python_boilerplate') from the template instead of prompting for a custom name (which would have defaulted to 'boilerplate' in the test environment). The directory name change in the assertions is a direct consequence of the parameter addition - both edits reference the same cookiecutter call and its output behavior within the same test function.

Both edits reference the exact same directory name 'python_boilerplate' in their changed lines. Edit 0 adds cleanup logic to remove the 'python_boilerplate' directory in a test fixture, while Edit 1 changes an assertion to check for a file within that same 'python_boilerplate' directory. These edits are part of the same test refactoring where the output directory name is being changed from 'boilerplate' to 'python_boilerplate'. The cleanup code and the assertion both need to reference the same directory path for the test to work correctly. Either edit could be made first and would create an immediate prompt for the other - if you change the assertion to look in 'python_boilerplate' but don't update the cleanup, or vice versa, you'd have a mismatch that would be mechanically obvious and require fixing.
